Reviews.Title: “Never happened to me before but be aware”
Reviews.Author: przemek w
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is not bad, room is comfortable, the breakfast are OK, but it was the first time that my items were stolen from my room. I arrived in the evening, checked in and went to my room. Next day I was having a meeting and I left my bathing items, cosmetics, etc. on the table, together with my book. After the whole day I came back to the hotel and my stuff was missing. I've contacted the reception desk, but the lady was only surprised, no action at all. I suggested to call housekeeping to ask them about this, I suspected they found my stuff and brought it to the reception desk, but they did not. So, the only thing I could do is to write them a letter asking if they find the items to sent them to my address, but that was a few weeks ago and no response so far. It is good I didn't leave my laptop there. I am aware, that it might be an isolated case, but it happened to me and please be aware with this hotel. I hope they are checking now if the inhabitant stays in the room for another night or not, in my case probably they didn't and clean the room to be ready for a new guest, however, it shouldn't happen that my stuff is missing. Other hotels gathering left items and contact recent guests to ask what to do with the items, either trash them or send them somewhere. I do travel a lot and stay in various hotels, but this was the first time something like that happened to me.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked it...”
Reviews.Author: jboano
Reviews.Content: Good price. Good hotel. Taxis costs around EUR 15 from airport. Train station is 3min walking and takes around 20min to Berlin center. 10 min to airport. And as a bonus there is a supermarket, Subway store, drugstore, bakery and food crossing the street. I'm from Brazil and had visited some cities at Europe. For sure this was the bes experience I had during this trip. Its is an excellent option to the ones who wnat to visit this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: finnmann
Reviews.Content: I cannot argue at all with the previous writers. AM campus is a nice hotel offering comfortable rooms at a great price. High ceilings make the rooms bigger than they really are simply decorated but very nice. The breakfast is nice enough fruits and yogurts and a hot meal as well. The location is a bit far from the center but the train station is a short walk away. The schönefeld airport is nearby too. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Also, helpful staff giving any info yiu need about about Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Am Campus”
Reviews.Author: bhchua
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel from 27 - 31Oct.06. Overall satisfactory. Near to the U-Bahn station at Adlershof (about 200m walk ). Easy to get to other parts of the city by public transport. Shopping easy too. Next to this hotel is a shopping centre where we got our provisions at a very reasonable price. Menu for breakfast = always the same during our stay. House keeping = average. Reception = good.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stwironbridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Aug 2006. I found the hotel very convenient for visiting the city. Near to the U-Bahn station at Adlershof. It was also very easy to get into the city on the public transport system. Easy to get to the airport ot Schonefeld too (only 3 stops away). It is a brand new hotel that opened on 22.07.06. All the room facilities worked, and it was very clean, quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was excellent. Great for people who want healthier options but you can also have a fry up, if you wish! All in all I think this is a great hotel and will stay there again on my future visits to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fidbod
Reviews.Content: When we found this hotel we read the description and saw that it is a training hotel for students that are going into the hotelier trade. This made us a bit suspious but we went anyway. The hotel is located in the outskirts of the former east berlin on S-bahn line S9 Adlershof stop and it is about 30 minutes by S-bahn to Friedrichstrasse. The room was very much business traveller style, the food and service was exemplary. It cost us £185 for two of us to stay five nights so I would throughly recommend the hotel. If you do stay here make sure you go to the following. Cocktail bar on Dorpfeldstrasse - fantastic mojitos, caprinhino's and long island iced teas - we both got legless for 30 euros total. Communist freedon fighter memorial on Dorpfeldstrasse Suzes cafe on adlergestell - good German food very well priced. Stuart

Reviews.Title: “IB Hotel Am Campus, Adlershof, Berlin”
Reviews.Author: kate_thirkell
Reviews.Content: i have just returned back from 4 nights stay in the IB Hotel Am Campus. the hotel is very new, modern, clean and simple. because of a certain low budget airline, best described as sleazyJet, my friend and i ended up staying for a fourth night here. the room was only 69 euro per night for a doubleroom which included breakfast. the hotel is great value for money. it is a well above average 3 star hotel. the staff were very friendly and helpful. any information we needed was efficiently provided. we stayed in room 341 for 3 nights and room 505 for 1 night. room 341 was huge! it even had a big wet room. the only downside to staying on that side of the hotel was that the view was straight onto a carpark, but even worse there were huge generators on top of the carpark that were really loud, which made sleeping with the window open impossible. in room 505, this was not a problem as it was on the opposite side of the hotel. however, this room was much smaller. (the pictures included in this review are from room 505). the hotel is a perfect stay for someone travelling from Schonefeld airport as it is only a 15/20 minute bus ride away from the airport (on bus numbers 162/163) or a 10 minute S bahn ride (line number S9 to Spandau). however, if your airport destination is Tegal or Templehof you might be best to find a more centrally located hotel as Adlershof is quite a way away from the city centre. the closest S bahn station was a 5 minute walk away and a 30/40 minute train ride got you to all the attractions in the centre of Berlin. we had a fantastic city break holiday and the hotel was superb value for money!!!
